<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<resources>
    <!-- Typography System using Inter for body text and Alegreya for large text -->
    
    <!-- Display Text - Major headings, hero text -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.Display" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.DisplayLarge">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">bold</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">32sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
        <item name="android:textColor">?attr/colorOnSurface</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Headlines - Section headers, major navigation -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.Headline" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.HeadlineMedium">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">bold</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">28sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Titles - Card titles, page titles, important text -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.Title" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.TitleMedium">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">20sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.3</item>
    </style>
    
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.TitleBold" parent="AppTextAppearance.Title">
        <item name="android:textStyle">bold</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- List Titles - Card titles, list item titles using Alegreya Medium for better readability -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.ListTitle" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.TitleMedium">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">500</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">20sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.3</item>
    </style>
    
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.ListTitleBold" parent="AppTextAppearance.ListTitle">
        <item name="android:textStyle">bold</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">700</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Body Text - Article content, descriptions, longer text -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.Body" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyLarge">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">16sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.BodyMedium" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyMedium">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">14sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- UI Labels - Buttons, navigation, short UI text -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.Label" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.LabelMedium">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">500</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">14sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.LabelLarge" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.LabelLarge">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">500</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">18sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Caption Text - Metadata, timestamps, auxiliary info -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.Caption" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodySmall">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Monospace - Code, technical text (using system monospace) -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.Mono" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyMedium">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">monospace</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">14sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.4</item>
    </style>
    
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.MonoBold" parent="AppTextAppearance.Mono">
        <item name="android:textStyle">bold</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Search Bar Specific -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.SearchBar" parent="AppTextAppearance.UIHint">
        <item name="android:textSize">16sp</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Navigation Specific -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.Navigation" parent="AppTextAppearance.UINavigation">
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Small Caps Styles -->
    <!-- Navigation Small Caps - Bottom nav labels, breadcrumbs -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.NavigationSmallCaps" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.LabelMedium">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya_sc</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
        <item name="android:letterSpacing">0.02</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Section Headers Small Caps - Category labels, section dividers -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.SectionHeaderSmallCaps" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.HeadlineMedium">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya_sc</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">bold</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">24sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
        <item name="android:letterSpacing">0.02</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Metadata Small Caps - Timestamps, article info, status labels -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.MetadataSmallCaps" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodySmall">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya_sc</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.3</item>
        <item name="android:letterSpacing">0.03</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Button Small Caps - Secondary action buttons -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.ButtonSmallCaps" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.LabelMedium">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya_sc</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">13sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.1</item>
        <item name="android:letterSpacing">0.02</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Tag Small Caps - Category tags, chips -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.TagSmallCaps" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.LabelSmall">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya_sc</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">13sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
        <item name="android:letterSpacing">0.04</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Enhanced Monospace Styles -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.MonoSmall" parent="AppTextAppearance.Mono">
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
    </style>
    
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.MonoLarge" parent="AppTextAppearance.Mono">
        <item name="android:textSize">16sp</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Enhanced Label Styles with Better Weight Support -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.LabelMedium" parent="AppTextAppearance.Label">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
    </style>
    
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.LabelBold" parent="AppTextAppearance.Label">
        <item name="android:textStyle">bold</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Enhanced Body Styles -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.BodySmall" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodySmall">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.BodyLarge" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyLarge">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">16sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- UI Styles - Pure interface elements -->
    <!-- Navigation Labels - Bottom nav, tabs, menu items -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.UINavigation" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.LabelMedium">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">500</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">14sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Button Text - All button labels -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.UIButton" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.LabelLarge">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.1</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Form Hints - Placeholder text, input hints -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.UIHint" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyMedium">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">16sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.3</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Form Labels - TextInputLayout labels -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.UIFormLabel" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodySmall">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">500</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">14sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Helper Text - Form helper text, validation messages -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.UIHelper" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodySmall">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.3</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Toolbar Titles - App bar titles -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.UIToolbar" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.TitleMedium">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">500</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">18sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Preference Styles - Settings screen text -->
    <!-- Preference Title - Medium weight for better readability in settings -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.TitleMedium">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">500</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">16sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.3</item>
        <item name="android:textColor">?attr/colorOnSurface</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Preference Summary - Regular weight for supporting text -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.PreferenceSummary" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyMedium">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">14sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.3</item>
        <item name="android:textColor">?attr/colorOnSurfaceVariant</item>
    </style>
    
</resources>

    <style name="Theme.OSRSWiki.OSRSDark" parent="Theme.OSRSWiki.Base.Dark">
        <item name="colorPrimary">@color/osrs_brown_deep</item>
        <item name="colorOnPrimary">@color/osrs_text_light</item>
        <item name="colorPrimaryContainer">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnPrimaryContainer">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="colorSecondary">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="colorOnSecondary">@color/osrs_brown_deep</item>
        <item name="colorSecondaryContainer">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnSecondaryContainer">@color/osrs_gold_muted</item>
        <item name="colorError">@color/color_error</item>
        <item name="colorOnError">@color/white</item>
        <item name="android:colorBackground">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnBackground">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="colorSurface">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnSurface">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="colorSurfaceVariant">@color/osrs_interface_grey_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnSurfaceVariant">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="android:statusBarColor">?attr/paper_color</item>

        <item name="paper_color">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="placeholder_color">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="popupMenuStyle">@style/App.Style.PopupMenu.OSRSDark</item>
        <item name="linkColor">@color/link_color_osrs_dark</item>
        <item name="primary_text_color">?attr/colorOnSurface</item>
        <item name="base_color">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="secondary_text_color">#B8B8B8</item>
        
        <!-- Typography overrides for OSRS Dark theme -->
        <item name="textAppearanceDisplayLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.Display</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceDisplayMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Display</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceDisplaySmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Display</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceHeadlineLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.Headline</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceHeadlineMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Headline</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceHeadlineSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Headline</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.TitleBold</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.TitleBold</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Title</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodyLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.Body</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodyMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.BodyMedium</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodySmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.BodySmall</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.LabelLarge</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Label</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Caption</item>
    </style>



    <style name="Widget.App.ActionMode" parent="Widget.Material3.ActionMode">
        <item name="background">?attr/colorSurface</item>
        <item name="backgroundSplit">@drawable/action_mode_border</item>
        <item name="elevation">0dp</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Preference Theme Overlay for better text styling -->
    <style name="PreferenceThemeOverlay.App" parent="PreferenceThemeOverlay.v14.Material">
        <!-- Override preference-specific styles -->
        <item name="preferenceStyle">@style/App.Preference</item>
        <item name="preferenceCategoryStyle">@style/App.Preference.Category</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Custom Preference Style -->
    <style name="App.Preference" parent="Preference.Material3">
        <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
        <item name="summaryTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceSummary</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Custom Preference Category Style -->
    <style name="App.Preference.Category" parent="PreferenceCategory.Material3">
        <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
    </style>

</resources>

message.content: i still see the same bold text. why? is the log not showing us any signs of issues? is the current font what is actually expected of standard material design principles? can we do a test to see if we can control this font weight at all? e.g. we can make that text regular instead. if it still looks bold after this then clearly the font is still not following our intentions

content.text: You're absolutely right - let's do a direct test to see if we can control the font weight at all. If we can't make it lighter than it currently appears, then something fundamental is wrong with our approach.

todos.content: Test if we can make preference text even lighter/thinner than normal
Check logcat for any preference theme application messages
Verify if current appearance matches Material Design standards
Investigate alternative approaches if theme isn't working

+    <!-- Preference Summary - TESTING: Ultra light weight and small size -->
+        <item name="android:textColor">#00FF00</item> <!-- Green color to test visibility -->
\ No newline at end of file

content.text: Absolutely! The test confirms that our theme-based styling is being completely overridden. Let me write a follow-up report for the experts.

input.content:
# Follow-Up: AndroidX Preference Styling Still Not Working

## Current Status
Following the expert recommendations from the first report, we implemented the suggested solutions but the preference text styling remains unchanged.

## What We Implemented

### 1. Disabled Manual Styling Code
```kotlin
// AppearanceSettingsFragment.kt - DISABLED these calls:
// setupFonts() // Line 47
// refreshPreferencesThemeDirectly() // Line 92
```
**Result**: Logcat confirms manual styling is no longer running (no more "Fonts applied to preference items" messages).

### 2. Implemented Correct Theme-Based Styling
Following both experts' guidance, we created:

```xml
<!-- themes.xml -->
<style name="PreferenceThemeOverlay.App" parent="PreferenceThemeOverlay.v14.Material">
    <!-- Override Material Design text appearances that preferences use -->
    <item name="textAppearanceTitleMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
    <item name="textAppearanceBodyMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceSummary</item>
    <item name="textAppearanceBodyLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
</style>
```

```xml
<!-- typography.xml -->
<style name="AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyLarge">
    <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
    <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
    <item name="android:textSize">16sp</item>
    <item name="android:textColor">?attr/colorOnSurface</item>
</style>
```

Applied to all base themes:
```xml
<item name="preferenceTheme">@style/PreferenceThemeOverlay.App</item>
```

**Result**: No visual change in preference text appearance.

## Definitive Test: Theme Overrides Are Not Working

To confirm our theme changes weren't taking effect, we applied an extreme test:

```xml
<!-- TESTING: Ultra light weight, tiny size, bright colors -->
<style name="AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle">
    <item name="android:fontWeight">100</item>      <!-- Thinnest possible -->
    <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>       <!-- Very small -->
    <item name="android:textColor">#FF0000</item>   <!-- Bright red -->
</style>

<style name="AppTextAppearance.PreferenceSummary">
    <item name="android:fontWeight">100</item>
    <item name="android:textSize">10sp</item>       <!-- Even smaller -->
    <item name="android:textColor">#00FF00</item>   <!-- Bright green -->
</style>
```

**Result**: Preference text remains exactly the same - same bold weight, same size, same standard colors. **None of our theme changes are being applied.**

## Current Evidence

### ✅ What's Working
- Manual styling code is successfully disabled (confirmed by logcat)
- App builds successfully with no theme errors
- Other app styling works normally

### ❌ What's Not Working  
- Preference text appearance remains unchanged despite theme overrides
- Extreme test styling (red/green colors, tiny sizes, thin weight) has zero effect
- Theme-based `preferenceTheme` overrides appear to be completely ignored

## Technical Questions for Experts

### 1. Theme Application Order
Are there other systems that could be overriding our `PreferenceThemeOverlay.App`? For example:
- Could the global theme `textAppearanceTitleMedium` override still take precedence?
- Are there other theme attributes we haven't considered?

### 2. AndroidX Preference Version Compatibility
Could this be a version compatibility issue? Our project uses:
```
implementation 'androidx.preference:preference-ktx:1.x.x' // (check exact version)
```

Are the attribute names different in newer/older versions?

### 3. Theme Context Investigation
How can we verify that `PreferenceFragmentCompat` is actually using our `preferenceTheme`? Are there:
- Debug methods to inspect the active theme context?
- Logcat tags that show theme resolution?
- Ways to verify which TextAppearance is being applied?

### 4. Alternative Diagnosis Approaches

Since theme-based styling appears completely ineffective, should we:
- Check if preferences are using custom layouts that ignore theme attributes?
- Inspect the actual preference XML inflation process?
- Try applying styles directly to individual preferences in XML?
- Use a different theme overlay parent (e.g., `ThemeOverlay.Material3.Preference`)?

### 5. Framework-Level Investigation
Could there be something in the AndroidX Preference library that:
- Forces specific text appearances regardless of theme?
- Has hardcoded styling that overrides theme attributes?
- Requires different attribute names than documented?

## Current Hypothesis
Our theme-based styling is being completely ignored by the AndroidX Preference system. Either:
1. We're using incorrect theme attributes or parent styles
2. There's another system overriding our theme (like global text appearance)
3. The preferences are using custom layouts that don't respect theme attributes
4. We have a version compatibility issue with the AndroidX Preference library

## Request for Expert Guidance
Given that our extreme test (bright colors, tiny text, thin weight) had absolutely no effect, we need guidance on:

1. **How to diagnose** what's actually controlling the preference text appearance
2. **Alternative approaches** if theme-based styling doesn't work for this project
3. **Debugging techniques** to see what TextAppearance is actually being applied
4. **Verification methods** to confirm our preferenceTheme is being used

The fact that even extreme styling changes (bright red color, 12sp size) are completely ignored suggests a fundamental issue with our approach rather than just incorrect attribute values.

```xml
<style name="PreferenceThemeOverlay.App" parent="PreferenceThemeOverlay.v14.Material">
    <!-- Override Material Design text appearances that preferences use -->
    <item name="textAppearanceTitleMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
    <item name="textAppearanceBodyMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceSummary</item>
    <item name="textAppearanceBodyLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
</style>
```

```xml
<!-- typography.xml -->
<style name="AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyLarge">
    <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
    <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
    <item name="android:textSize">16sp</item>
    <item name="android:textColor">?attr/colorOnSurface</item>
</style>
```

Applied to all base themes:
```xml
<item name="preferenceTheme">@style/PreferenceThemeOverlay.App</item>
```

**Result**: No visual change in preference text appearance.

## Definitive Test: Theme Overrides Are Not Working

To confirm our theme changes weren't taking effect, we applied an extreme test:

```xml
<!-- TESTING: Ultra light weight, tiny size, bright colors -->
<style name="AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle">
    <item name="android:fontWeight">100</item>      <!-- Thinnest possible -->
    <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>       <!-- Very small -->
    <item name="android:textColor">#FF0000</item>   <!-- Bright red -->
</style>

<style name="AppTextAppearance.PreferenceSummary">
    <item name="android:fontWeight">100</item>
    <item name="android:textSize">10sp</item>       <!-- Even smaller -->
    <item name="android:textColor">#00FF00</item>   <!-- Bright green -->
</style>
```

**Result**: Preference text remains exactly the same - same bold weight, same size, same standard colors. **None of our theme changes are being applied.**

## Current Evidence

### ✅ What's Working
- Manual styling code is successfully disabled (confirmed by logcat)
- App builds successfully with no theme errors
- Other app styling works normally

### ❌ What's Not Working  
- Preference text appearance remains unchanged despite theme overrides
- Extreme test styling (red/green colors, tiny sizes, thin weight) has zero effect
- Theme-based `preferenceTheme` overrides appear to be completely ignored

## Technical Questions for Experts

### 1. Theme Application Order
Are there other systems that could be overriding our `PreferenceThemeOverlay.App`? For example:
- Could the global theme `textAppearanceTitleMedium` override still take precedence?
- Are there other theme attributes we haven't considered?

### 2. AndroidX Preference Version Compatibility
Could this be a version compatibility issue? Our project uses:
```
implementation 'androidx.preference:preference-ktx:1.x.x' // (check exact version)
```

Are the attribute names different in newer/older versions?

### 3. Theme Context Investigation
How can we verify that `PreferenceFragmentCompat` is actually using our `preferenceTheme`? Are there:
- Debug methods to inspect the active theme context?
- Logcat tags that show theme resolution?
- Ways to verify which TextAppearance is being applied?

### 4. Alternative Diagnosis Approaches

Since theme-based styling appears completely ineffective, should we:
- Check if preferences are using custom layouts that ignore theme attributes?
- Inspect the actual preference XML inflation process?
- Try applying styles directly to individual preferences in XML?
- Use a different theme overlay parent (e.g., `ThemeOverlay.Material3.Preference`)?

### 5. Framework-Level Investigation
Could there be something in the AndroidX Preference library that:
- Forces specific text appearances regardless of theme?
- Has hardcoded styling that overrides theme attributes?
- Requires different attribute names than documented?

## Current Hypothesis
Our theme-based styling is being completely ignored by the AndroidX Preference system. Either:
1. We're using incorrect theme attributes or parent styles
2. There's another system overriding our theme (like global text appearance)
3. The preferences are using custom layouts that don't respect theme attributes
4. We have a version compatibility issue with the AndroidX Preference library

## Request for Expert Guidance
Given that our extreme test (bright colors, tiny text, thin weight) had absolutely no effect, we need guidance on:

1. **How to diagnose** what's actually controlling the preference text appearance
2. **Alternative approaches** if theme-based styling doesn't work for this project
3. **Debugging techniques** to see what TextAppearance is actually being applied
4. **Verification methods** to confirm our preferenceTheme is being used

The fact that even extreme styling changes (bright red color, 12sp size) are completely ignored suggests a fundamental issue with our approach rather than just incorrect attribute values.

content.text:
## Follow-Up Report Complete

I've created a comprehensive follow-up report at `/Users/miyawaki/Android/osrswiki/preference-styling-follow-up-report.md` that documents our findings and asks the experts for further guidance.

## Key Points in the Report:

1. **Confirmed Issue**: Our extreme test with bright red color, 12sp text size, and ultra-thin weight had **zero visual effect**, proving that our theme-based styling is being completely overridden or ignored.

2. **What We Successfully Implemented**: 
   - Disabled manual styling code (confirmed working)
   - Applied correct AndroidX Preference theme attributes as recommended
   - Used proper theme overlay structure

3. **Critical Finding**: Even the most extreme styling changes (bright colors, tiny text, thin font weight) are completely ignored, indicating a fundamental issue with our theme-based approach.

4. **Expert Questions**: The report asks for guidance on debugging techniques, alternative approaches, and how to diagnose what's actually controlling the preference text appearance.

This clearly shows that something deeper is overriding our theme changes, and we need expert guidance on alternative diagnostic approaches or different styling methods for AndroidX Preferences in this specific project setup.

message.content:
this is what expert 1 says:  Excellent diagnostic work. The "Definitive Test" you ran is the most critical piece of evidence here. The fact that extreme styling changes (bright red text, 12sp size) had no effect confirms your hypothesis: the `preferenceTheme` is being completely ignored. This is not a subtle precedence issue; there is a fundamental disconnect between your theme and the preferences being rendered.

Our new primary hypothesis is that the preferences are being forced to use a **custom layout** that contains hardcoded styling, which would completely bypass any theme attributes.

Here is a systematic plan to diagnose and resolve this.

-----

### Diagnostic Plan

We will investigate in order of likelihood, starting with the prime suspect: custom layouts.

#### Step 1: Check for Custom Preference Layouts

The most common reason for a theme to be ignored is that the preference XML specifies a custom `app:layout` that contains hardcoded styles. Let's verify this first.

```bash
# Search the preference XML file for any "app:layout" attributes.
# This will immediately tell us if a custom layout is being used.
grep "app:layout" app/src/main/res/xml/preferences_appearance.xml
```

**Expected Outcome:**

  * **If this command returns any lines:** You have found the culprit. The next step is to examine the layout file(s) it points to (e.g., `res/layout/my_custom_preference.xml`). You will likely find hardcoded attributes like `android:textStyle="bold"` or a specific `android:textAppearance` that overrides the theme.
  * **If this command returns nothing:** Your preferences are using the default layouts, and we can proceed to the next diagnostic step.

-----

#### Step 2: Verify the Theme Chain and Context

It's possible the `Activity` hosting your `PreferenceFragmentCompat` is using a different theme than you expect—one that does *not* include your `preferenceTheme` item.

```bash
# 1. Identify the theme of the Activity hosting the preferences.
#    Replace 'YourSettingsActivity' with the actual name from your project.
grep -A 2 "YourSettingsActivity" app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml

# 2. Check the identified theme file (e.g., res/values/themes.xml).
#    Confirm that the <item name="preferenceTheme"> line exists within the
#    correct <style> block that is being applied to your Activity.
```

If the `Activity` theme is correct, we must verify what the fragment sees at runtime.

**Action: Programmatic Theme Verification**
Place this debug code inside the `onViewCreated` method of `AppearanceSettingsFragment.kt`. This will tell you definitively which `preferenceTheme`, if any, the fragment is resolving.

```kotlin
// Add this to onViewCreated in AppearanceSettingsFragment.kt
Log.d("ThemeCheck", "--- Verifying Preference Theme ---")
val typedValue = android.util.TypedValue()
val themeResolved = requireContext().theme.resolveAttribute(
    androidx.preference.R.attr.preferenceTheme,
    typedValue,
    true
)

if (themeResolved) {
    val themeResId = typedValue.resourceId
    val themeName = resources.getResourceName(themeResId)
    Log.d("ThemeCheck", "Preference theme is RESOLVED: $themeName (ID: $themeResId)")
} else {
    Log.d("ThemeCheck", "Preference theme is NOT RESOLVED. Using default theme.")
}
```

Check logcat for the `ThemeCheck` tag. This will give you the ground truth about which theme is being used.

-----

#### Step 3: Use the Layout Inspector

Android Studio's Layout Inspector is the perfect tool for this situation. It allows you to see exactly which properties are being applied to a `View` and where they came from.

1.  Run the app and navigate to the settings screen.
2.  Go to **Tools \> Layout Inspector**.
3.  Select your app's process.
4.  In the component tree, click on the `TextView` for a preference title.
5.  In the **Attributes** pane on the right, look for the `textAppearance` attribute.
      * The inspector will show you the full inheritance chain and which XML file or style is responsible for the final computed value.
      * This will likely point you directly to the source of the hardcoded bold style.
6.  Also, check for a `layout` attribute, which will confirm which XML layout file was used to inflate that specific view, reinforcing the findings from Step 1.

This is the most direct way to answer your question: "How can we see what `TextAppearance` is actually being applied?"

-----

### Summary of Approach

Your problem is no longer about finding the *right* theme attributes, but about finding out **why your theme isn't being applied at all**.

1.  **First, check for custom layouts** in `preferences_appearance.xml`. This is the most likely cause.
2.  If that yields nothing, **verify the full theme chain** from the `AndroidManifest.xml` to your activity to your fragment, using the programmatic check to get runtime proof.
3.  Finally, use the **Layout Inspector** as the ultimate tool to inspect the final, rendered view and trace its styling back to the source.

This systematic process will pinpoint the exact location of the override, allowing you to either remove the hardcoded styles from the custom layout or fix the broken theme chain.an and expert 2: **Why your “extreme” TextAppearance is still ignored**

1. **The wrong knob is being turned**
   AndroidX Preference reads **`titleTextAppearance`** and **`summaryTextAppearance`** that live *inside the style referenced by `preferenceStyle`* (or `preferenceCategoryStyle`). It never looks at `textAppearanceTitleMedium`, `textAppearanceBodyMedium`, or `textAppearanceListItem*`. That is why changing those attributes (even to bright-red 12 sp) does nothing. ([Stack Overflow][1], [GitHub][2])

2. **Overlay parent is obsolete**
   `PreferenceThemeOverlay.v14.Material` is the old AppCompat overlay.
   With `androidx.preference:preference-ktx 1.2.x` (the current stable) the matching overlay is **`ThemeOverlay.Material3.Preference`**. If you inherit from the v14 overlay the newer attributes are silently dropped.

3. **Where the fragment picks its theme**
   `PreferenceFragmentCompat` asks the host *context* for `R.attr.preferenceTheme`; that means the ***Activity* theme** (or the `android:theme` you set on the `<fragment>` tag) must contain

   ```xml
   <item name="preferenceTheme">@style/PrefOverlay.MyApp</item>
   ```

   Putting that line in `Theme.MyApp` **is not enough** if Settings runs in a separate Activity that uses `Theme.MyApp.Settings` instead.

---

### A minimal setup that *does* change weight / color / size

```xml
<!-- 1) Activity theme that hosts the PreferenceFragment -->
<style name="Theme.MyApp.Settings" parent="Theme.Material3.DayNight.NoActionBar">
    <item name="preferenceTheme">@style/PrefOverlay.MyApp</item>
</style>

<!-- 2) The overlay that the fragment will use -->
<style name="PrefOverlay.MyApp" parent="ThemeOverlay.Material3.Preference">
    <item name="preferenceStyle">@style/PrefStyle.MyApp</item>
    <item name="preferenceCategoryStyle">@style/PrefCatStyle.MyApp</item>
</style>

<!-- 3) Base style for every single Preference row -->
<style name="PrefStyle.MyApp" parent="Preference.Material3">
    <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/TextAppearance.MyPref.Title</item>
    <item name="summaryTextAppearance">@style/TextAppearance.MyPref.Summary</item>
</style>

<!-- 4) What the TextViews finally use -->
<style name="TextAppearance.MyPref.Title" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyLarge">
    <item name="android:fontFamily">sans-serif</item>
    <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>   <!-- kills the bold -->
    <item name="android:textColor">#FF0000</item>  <!-- now really red -->
    <item name="android:textSize">16sp</item>
</style>

<style name="TextAppearance.MyPref.Summary" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyMedium">
    <item name="android:textColor">#00FF00</item>
    <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
</style>

<!-- 5) Category header (optional) -->
<style name="PrefCatStyle.MyApp" parent="PreferenceCategory.Material3">
    <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/TextAppearance.MyPref.Title</item>
</style>
```

*Build and open the screen – the titles are red, 16 sp, non-bold; the summaries are green, 12 sp. No runtime code is required.*

---

### How to verify what the fragment really uses

| What to check                     | Quick technique                                                                                                                                                                                |
| --------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Which theme the fragment receives | Inside `onCreatePreferences` log `requireContext().theme.obtainStyledAttributes(intArrayOf(androidx.preference.R.attr.preferenceStyle))[0]` to see the resolved style id.                      |
| What TextAppearance reaches a row | Use **Layout Inspector** → select the TextView → Attributes → `textAppearance`.                                                                                                                |
| Attribute precedence              | Remember: View attribute > style > theme overlay > base theme. A global `textAppearanceTitleMedium` in `Theme.MyApp` will not override `titleTextAppearance` that is set in `PrefStyle.MyApp`. |

---

### Answers to your five new questions

1. **Theme-application order** – the fragment’s `preferenceTheme` wins over everything except explicit `app:titleTextAppearance` etc. on individual `<Preference>` tags.
2. **Library version** – 1.2.0+ expects Material3 names; 1.1.x still used the v14 overlay. Check `gradle libs` and switch overlays accordingly.
3. **Debugging theme context** – see the logging snippet above or use `LayoutInspector` for live views.
4. **Alternative diagnosis** – if a row ignores the appearance, inspect its layout id via `holder.itemView.layoutResource`; a custom layout can bypass TextAppearance entirely.
5. **Framework overrides** – none; AndroidX Preference only hard-codes fallback defaults *until* you supply `titleTextAppearance` / `summaryTextAppearance`.

---

### TL;DR

* Put your colors/weights in `titleTextAppearance` & `summaryTextAppearance`.
* Attach them through `preferenceStyle` inside a **Material3** preference overlay.
* Point `preferenceTheme` at that overlay in the *Activity* that hosts the fragment.

Do that, and the bright red / bright green test will finally show up.

[1]: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/38279034/set-title-style-for-preferencecategory-in-preferencefragmentcompat "android - Set Title style for PreferenceCategory in PreferenceFragmentCompat - Stack Overflow"
[2]: https://github.com/consp1racy/android-support-preference/issues/109?utm_source=chatgpt.com "How to change title text size? · Issue #109 - GitHub"

    <style name="Theme.OSRSWiki.OSRSDark" parent="Theme.OSRSWiki.Base.Dark">
        <item name="colorPrimary">@color/osrs_brown_deep</item>
        <item name="colorOnPrimary">@color/osrs_text_light</item>
        <item name="colorPrimaryContainer">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnPrimaryContainer">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="colorSecondary">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="colorOnSecondary">@color/osrs_brown_deep</item>
        <item name="colorSecondaryContainer">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnSecondaryContainer">@color/osrs_gold_muted</item>
        <item name="colorError">@color/color_error</item>
        <item name="colorOnError">@color/white</item>

        <item name="colorOnBackground">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="colorSurface">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>

        <item name="paper_color">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="placeholder_color">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="popupMenuStyle">@style/App.Style.PopupMenu.OSRSDark</item>
        <item name="linkColor">@color/link_color_osrs_dark</item>

        <item name="base_color">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="secondary_text_color">#B8B8B8</item>
        
        <!-- Typography overrides for OSRS Dark theme -->
        <item name="textAppearanceDisplayLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.Display</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceDisplayMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Display</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceDisplaySmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Display</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceHeadlineLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.Headline</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceHeadlineMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Headline</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceHeadlineSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Headline</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.TitleBold</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.TitleBold</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Title</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodyLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.Body</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodyMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.BodyMedium</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodySmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.BodySmall</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.LabelLarge</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Label</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Caption</item>
    </style>



    <style name="Widget.App.ActionMode" parent="Widget.Material3.ActionMode">
        <item name="background">?attr/colorSurface</item>
        <item name="backgroundSplit">@drawable/action_mode_border</item>
        <item name="elevation">0dp</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Preference Theme Overlay for better text styling -->
    <style name="PreferenceThemeOverlay.App" parent="PreferenceThemeOverlay.v14.Material">
        <!-- Override Material Design text appearances that preferences use -->
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodyMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceSummary</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodyLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
    </style>

</resources>

input.old_string:

    <!-- Preference Title - TESTING: Ultra light weight and small size to verify theme control -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyLarge">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">100</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
        <item name="android:textColor">#FF0000</item> <!-- Red color to test visibility -->
    </style>
    
    <!-- Preference Summary - TESTING: Ultra light weight and small size -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.PreferenceSummary" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyMedium">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">100</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">10sp</item>
        <item name="android:textColor">#00FF00</item> <!-- Green color to test visibility -->
    </style>

<!-- Preference Styles - Settings screen text with normal weight (not bold) -->

    <style name="AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyLarge">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">sans-serif</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">16sp</item>
        <item name="android:textColor">?attr/colorOnSurface</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Preference Summary - Normal weight for supporting text -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.PreferenceSummary" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyMedium">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">sans-serif</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">14sp</item>
        <item name="android:textColor">?attr/colorOnSurfaceVariant</item>
    </style>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<resources>
    <!-- Typography System using Inter for body text and Alegreya for large text -->
    
    <!-- Display Text - Major headings, hero text -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.Display" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.DisplayLarge">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">bold</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">32sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
        <item name="android:textColor">?attr/colorOnSurface</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Headlines - Section headers, major navigation -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.Headline" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.HeadlineMedium">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">bold</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">28sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Titles - Card titles, page titles, important text -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.Title" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.TitleMedium">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">20sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.3</item>
    </style>
    
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.TitleBold" parent="AppTextAppearance.Title">
        <item name="android:textStyle">bold</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- List Titles - Card titles, list item titles using Alegreya Medium for better readability -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.ListTitle" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.TitleMedium">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">500</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">20sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.3</item>
    </style>
    
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.ListTitleBold" parent="AppTextAppearance.ListTitle">
        <item name="android:textStyle">bold</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">700</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Body Text - Article content, descriptions, longer text -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.Body" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyLarge">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">16sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.BodyMedium" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyMedium">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">14sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- UI Labels - Buttons, navigation, short UI text -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.Label" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.LabelMedium">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">500</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">14sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.LabelLarge" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.LabelLarge">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">500</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">18sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Caption Text - Metadata, timestamps, auxiliary info -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.Caption" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodySmall">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Monospace - Code, technical text (using system monospace) -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.Mono" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyMedium">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">monospace</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">14sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.4</item>
    </style>
    
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.MonoBold" parent="AppTextAppearance.Mono">
        <item name="android:textStyle">bold</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Search Bar Specific -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.SearchBar" parent="AppTextAppearance.UIHint">
        <item name="android:textSize">16sp</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Navigation Specific -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.Navigation" parent="AppTextAppearance.UINavigation">
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Small Caps Styles -->
    <!-- Navigation Small Caps - Bottom nav labels, breadcrumbs -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.NavigationSmallCaps" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.LabelMedium">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya_sc</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
        <item name="android:letterSpacing">0.02</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Section Headers Small Caps - Category labels, section dividers -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.SectionHeaderSmallCaps" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.HeadlineMedium">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya_sc</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">bold</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">24sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
        <item name="android:letterSpacing">0.02</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Metadata Small Caps - Timestamps, article info, status labels -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.MetadataSmallCaps" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodySmall">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya_sc</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.3</item>
        <item name="android:letterSpacing">0.03</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Button Small Caps - Secondary action buttons -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.ButtonSmallCaps" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.LabelMedium">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya_sc</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">13sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.1</item>
        <item name="android:letterSpacing">0.02</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Tag Small Caps - Category tags, chips -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.TagSmallCaps" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.LabelSmall">
        <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/alegreya_sc</item>
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">13sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
        <item name="android:letterSpacing">0.04</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Enhanced Monospace Styles -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.MonoSmall" parent="AppTextAppearance.Mono">
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
    </style>
    
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.MonoLarge" parent="AppTextAppearance.Mono">
        <item name="android:textSize">16sp</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Enhanced Label Styles with Better Weight Support -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.LabelMedium" parent="AppTextAppearance.Label">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
    </style>
    
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.LabelBold" parent="AppTextAppearance.Label">
        <item name="android:textStyle">bold</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Enhanced Body Styles -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.BodySmall" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodySmall">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.BodyLarge" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyLarge">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">16sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- UI Styles - Pure interface elements -->
    <!-- Navigation Labels - Bottom nav, tabs, menu items -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.UINavigation" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.LabelMedium">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">500</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">14sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Button Text - All button labels -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.UIButton" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.LabelLarge">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.1</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Form Hints - Placeholder text, input hints -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.UIHint" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyMedium">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">16sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.3</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Form Labels - TextInputLayout labels -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.UIFormLabel" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodySmall">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">500</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">14sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Helper Text - Form helper text, validation messages -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.UIHelper" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodySmall">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">400</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.3</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Toolbar Titles - App bar titles -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.UIToolbar" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.TitleMedium">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">500</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">18sp</item>
        <item name="android:lineSpacingMultiplier">1.2</item>
    </style>
    
    <!-- Preference Styles - Settings screen text -->
    <!-- Preference Title - TESTING: Ultra light weight and small size to verify theme control -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyLarge">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">100</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">12sp</item>
        <item name="android:textColor">#FF0000</item> <!-- Red color to test visibility -->
    </style>
    
    <!-- Preference Summary - TESTING: Ultra light weight and small size -->
    <style name="AppTextAppearance.PreferenceSummary" parent="TextAppearance.Material3.BodyMedium">
        <item name="android:textStyle">normal</item>
        <item name="android:fontWeight">100</item>
        <item name="android:textSize">10sp</item>
        <item name="android:textColor">#00FF00</item> <!-- Green color to test visibility -->
    </style>
    
</resources>

    <style name="Theme.OSRSWiki.OSRSDark" parent="Theme.OSRSWiki.Base.Dark">
        <item name="colorPrimary">@color/osrs_brown_deep</item>
        <item name="colorOnPrimary">@color/osrs_text_light</item>
        <item name="colorPrimaryContainer">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnPrimaryContainer">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="colorSecondary">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="colorOnSecondary">@color/osrs_brown_deep</item>
        <item name="colorSecondaryContainer">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnSecondaryContainer">@color/osrs_gold_muted</item>
        <item name="colorError">@color/color_error</item>
        <item name="colorOnError">@color/white</item>
        <item name="android:colorBackground">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnBackground">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="colorSurface">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnSurface">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="colorSurfaceVariant">@color/osrs_interface_grey_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnSurfaceVariant">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="android:statusBarColor">?attr/paper_color</item>

        <item name="paper_color">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="placeholder_color">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="popupMenuStyle">@style/App.Style.PopupMenu.OSRSDark</item>
        <item name="linkColor">@color/link_color_osrs_dark</item>
        <item name="primary_text_color">?attr/colorOnSurface</item>
        <item name="base_color">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="secondary_text_color">#B8B8B8</item>
        
        <!-- Typography overrides for OSRS Dark theme -->
        <item name="textAppearanceDisplayLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.Display</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceDisplayMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Display</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceDisplaySmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Display</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceHeadlineLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.Headline</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceHeadlineMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Headline</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceHeadlineSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Headline</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.TitleBold</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.TitleBold</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Title</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodyLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.Body</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodyMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.BodyMedium</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodySmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.BodySmall</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.LabelLarge</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Label</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Caption</item>
    </style>



    <style name="Widget.App.ActionMode" parent="Widget.Material3.ActionMode">
        <item name="background">?attr/colorSurface</item>
        <item name="backgroundSplit">@drawable/action_mode_border</item>
        <item name="elevation">0dp</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Preference Theme Overlay - Using correct Material3 parent and attributes -->
    <style name="PreferenceThemeOverlay.App" parent="ThemeOverlay.Material3.Preference">
        <!-- Override preference styles to use our custom text appearances -->
        <item name="preferenceStyle">@style/App.Preference</item>
        <item name="preferenceCategoryStyle">@style/App.Preference.Category</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Custom Preference Style - Uses correct titleTextAppearance/summaryTextAppearance -->
    <style name="App.Preference" parent="Preference.Material3">
        <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
        <item name="summaryTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceSummary</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Custom Preference Category Style -->
    <style name="App.Preference.Category" parent="PreferenceCategory.Material3">
        <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
    </style>

</resources>

        <item name="textAppearanceTitleMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.TitleBold</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Title</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodyLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.Body</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodyMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.BodyMedium</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodySmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.BodySmall</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.LabelLarge</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Label</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Caption</item>
    </style>



    <style name="Widget.App.ActionMode" parent="Widget.Material3.ActionMode">
        <item name="background">?attr/colorSurface</item>
        <item name="backgroundSplit">@drawable/action_mode_border</item>
        <item name="elevation">0dp</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Preference Theme Overlay - Using available overlay parent -->
    <style name="PreferenceThemeOverlay.App" parent="PreferenceThemeOverlay.v14.Material">
        <!-- Override preference styles to use our custom text appearances -->
        <item name="preferenceStyle">@style/App.Preference</item>
        <item name="preferenceCategoryStyle">@style/App.Preference.Category</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Custom Preference Style - Uses correct titleTextAppearance/summaryTextAppearance -->
    <style name="App.Preference" parent="Preference.Material">
        <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
        <item name="summaryTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceSummary</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Custom Preference Category Style -->
    <style name="App.Preference.Category" parent="Preference.Category.Material">
        <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
    </style>

</resources>

<!-- Preference Theme Overlay - Using available overlay parent -->
    <style name="PreferenceThemeOverlay.App" parent="PreferenceThemeOverlay.v14.Material">
        <!-- Override preference styles to use our custom text appearances -->
        <item name="preferenceStyle">@style/App.Preference</item>
        <item name="preferenceCategoryStyle">@style/App.Preference.Category</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Custom Preference Style - Uses correct titleTextAppearance -->
    <style name="App.Preference" parent="Preference.Material">
        <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Custom Preference Category Style -->

        <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
    </style>
input.new_string:
<!-- Preference Theme Overlay - Following Expert 2's guidance exactly -->
    <style name="PreferenceThemeOverlay.App" parent="@android:style/ThemeOverlay.Material3.Preference">
        <item name="preferenceStyle">@style/App.Preference</item>
        <item name="preferenceCategoryStyle">@style/App.Preference.Category</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Custom Preference Style with titleTextAppearance and summaryTextAppearance -->
    <style name="App.Preference" parent="@android:style/Preference.Material3">
        <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
        <item name="summaryTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceSummary</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Custom Preference Category Style -->
    <style name="App.Preference.Category" parent="@android:style/PreferenceCategory.Material3">
        <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
    </style>

<resources xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools">

    <style name="Theme.OSRSWiki" parent="Theme.Material3.DayNight.NoActionBar">
        <item name="android:windowActivityTransitions">true</item>
        <item name="colorPrimary">@color/osrs_brown_deep</item>
        <item name="colorOnPrimary">@color/osrs_text_light</item>
        <item name="colorPrimaryContainer">@color/osrs_parchment_medium</item>
        <item name="colorOnPrimaryContainer">@color/osrs_text_dark</item>
        <item name="colorSecondary">@color/osrs_gold</item>
        <item name="colorOnSecondary">@color/osrs_brown_deep</item>
        <item name="colorSecondaryContainer">@color/osrs_parchment_medium</item>
        <item name="colorOnSecondaryContainer">@color/black</item>
        <item name="colorError">@color/color_error</item>
        <item name="colorOnError">@color/white</item>
        <item name="android:colorBackground">@color/osrs_parchment_light</item>
        <item name="colorOnBackground">@color/osrs_text_dark</item>
        <item name="colorSurface">@color/osrs_parchment_light</item>
        <item name="colorOnSurface">@color/osrs_text_dark</item>
        <item name="colorSurfaceVariant">@color/osrs_parchment_light</item>
        <item name="colorOnSurfaceVariant">@color/osrs_text_dark</item>
        <item name="android:windowBackground">?attr/paper_color</item>
        <item name="android:statusBarColor">?attr/paper_color</item>
        <item name="android:windowLightStatusBar">true</item>
        <item name="paper_color">@color/osrs_parchment_light</item>
        <item name="bottom_nav_background_color">?attr/paper_color</item>
        <item name="placeholder_color">@color/osrs_brown_deep</item>
        <item name="tabCountBackgroundColor">@android:color/transparent</item>
        <item name="tabCountTextColor">?attr/colorOnSurface</item>
        <item name="tabCountBorderColor">?attr/colorControlNormal</item>
        <item name="search_box_background_color">#1A000000</item>
        <item name="popupMenuStyle">@style/App.Style.PopupMenu</item>
        <item name="border_color">?attr/colorSurfaceVariant</item>
        <item name="primary_text_color">?attr/colorOnSurface</item>
        <item name="base_color">@color/osrs_parchment_light</item>
        <item name="secondary_text_color">@color/osrs_text_dark</item>
        <item name="colorControlHighlight">@color/ripple_light</item>
        <item name="preferenceTheme">@style/PreferenceThemeOverlay.App</item>
    </style>

    <style name="Theme.OSRSWiki.Base.Light" parent="Theme.Material3.Light.NoActionBar">

        <item name="secondary_text_color">#757575</item>
        <item name="preferenceTheme">@style/PreferenceThemeOverlay.App</item>
    </style>

    <style name="Theme.OSRSWiki.Base.Dark" parent="Theme.Material3.Dark.NoActionBar">
        <item name="elevationOverlayEnabled">false</item>
        <item name="materialCardViewStyle">@style/Widget.OSRSWiki.CardView</item>
        <item name="android:windowBackground">?attr/paper_color</item>

        <item name="bottom_nav_background_color">?attr/paper_color</item>

        <item name="android:outlineSpotShadowColor" tools:targetApi="p">@color/black</item>

        <item name="base_color">?attr/colorSurface</item>
        <item name="secondary_text_color">#BDBDBD</item>
        <item name="preferenceTheme">@style/PreferenceThemeOverlay.App</item>
    </style>

    <style name="Theme.OSRSWiki.OSRSLight" parent="Theme.OSRSWiki.Base.Light">
        <item name="colorPrimary">@color/osrs_brown_deep</item>
        <item name="colorOnPrimary">@color/osrs_text_light</item>
        <item name="colorPrimaryContainer">@color/osrs_parchment_medium</item>
        <item name="colorOnPrimaryContainer">@color/osrs_text_dark</item>
        <item name="colorSecondary">@color/osrs_brown_deep</item>
        <item name="colorOnSecondary">@color/osrs_text_light</item>
        <item name="colorSecondaryContainer">@color/osrs_parchment_medium</item>
        <item name="colorOnSecondaryContainer">@color/black</item>
        <item name="colorError">@color/color_error</item>
        <item name="colorOnError">@color/white</item>

        <item name="colorOnBackground">@color/osrs_text_dark</item>
        <item name="colorSurface">@color/osrs_parchment_light</item>
        <item name="colorOnSurface">@color/osrs_text_dark</item>
        <item name="colorSurfaceVariant">@color/osrs_parchment_surface_light</item>
        <item name="colorOnSurfaceVariant">@color/osrs_text_dark</item>
        <item name="android:statusBarColor">?attr/paper_color</item>

        <item name="paper_color">@color/osrs_parchment_light</item>
        <item name="placeholder_color">@color/osrs_brown_deep</item>
        <item name="popupMenuStyle">@style/App.Style.PopupMenu.OSRSLight</item>
        <item name="linkColor">@color/link_color_osrs_light</item>
        <item name="primary_text_color">?attr/colorOnSurface</item>
        <item name="base_color">@color/osrs_parchment_light</item>
        <item name="secondary_text_color">@color/osrs_text_secondary_light</item>
        
        <!-- Typography overrides for OSRS theme -->
        <item name="textAppearanceDisplayLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.Display</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceDisplayMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Display</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceDisplaySmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Display</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceHeadlineLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.Headline</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceHeadlineMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Headline</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceHeadlineSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Headline</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.TitleBold</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.TitleBold</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Title</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodyLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.Body</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodyMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.BodyMedium</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodySmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.BodySmall</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.LabelLarge</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Label</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Caption</item>
    </style>


    <style name="Theme.OSRSWiki.OSRSDark" parent="Theme.OSRSWiki.Base.Dark">
        <item name="colorPrimary">@color/osrs_brown_deep</item>
        <item name="colorOnPrimary">@color/osrs_text_light</item>
        <item name="colorPrimaryContainer">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnPrimaryContainer">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="colorSecondary">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="colorOnSecondary">@color/osrs_brown_deep</item>
        <item name="colorSecondaryContainer">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnSecondaryContainer">@color/osrs_gold_muted</item>
        <item name="colorError">@color/color_error</item>
        <item name="colorOnError">@color/white</item>
        <item name="android:colorBackground">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnBackground">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="colorSurface">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnSurface">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="colorSurfaceVariant">@color/osrs_interface_grey_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnSurfaceVariant">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="android:statusBarColor">?attr/paper_color</item>

        <item name="paper_color">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="placeholder_color">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>
        <item name="popupMenuStyle">@style/App.Style.PopupMenu.OSRSDark</item>
        <item name="linkColor">@color/link_color_osrs_dark</item>
        <item name="primary_text_color">?attr/colorOnSurface</item>
        <item name="base_color">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="secondary_text_color">#B8B8B8</item>
        
        <!-- Typography overrides for OSRS Dark theme -->
        <item name="textAppearanceDisplayLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.Display</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceDisplayMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Display</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceDisplaySmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Display</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceHeadlineLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.Headline</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceHeadlineMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Headline</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceHeadlineSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Headline</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.TitleBold</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.TitleBold</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceTitleSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Title</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodyLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.Body</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodyMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.BodyMedium</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceBodySmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.BodySmall</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelLarge">@style/AppTextAppearance.LabelLarge</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Label</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Caption</item>
    </style>



    <style name="Widget.App.ActionMode" parent="Widget.Material3.ActionMode">
        <item name="background">?attr/colorSurface</item>
        <item name="backgroundSplit">@drawable/action_mode_border</item>
        <item name="elevation">0dp</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Preference Theme Overlay - Using available overlay parent -->
    <style name="PreferenceThemeOverlay.App" parent="PreferenceThemeOverlay.v14.Material">
        <!-- Override preference styles to use our custom text appearances -->
        <item name="preferenceStyle">@style/App.Preference</item>
        <item name="preferenceCategoryStyle">@style/App.Preference.Category</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Custom Preference Style - Uses correct titleTextAppearance -->
    <style name="App.Preference" parent="Preference.Material">
        <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Custom Preference Category Style -->
    <style name="App.Preference.Category" parent="Preference.Category.Material">
        <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
    </style>

</resources>

        <item name="preferenceStyle">@style/App.Preference</item>
        <item name="preferenceCategoryStyle">@style/App.Preference.Category</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Custom Preference Style with titleTextAppearance and summaryTextAppearance -->
    <style name="App.Preference" parent="@android:style/Preference.Material3">
        <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
        <item name="summaryTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceSummary</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Custom Preference Category Style -->
    <style name="App.Preference.Category" parent="@android:style/PreferenceCategory.Material3">
        <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
    </style>
input.new_string:
<!-- Preference Theme Overlay - Using available MaterialComponents styles -->
    <style name="PreferenceThemeOverlay.App" parent="PreferenceThemeOverlay.v14.Material">
        <item name="preferenceStyle">@style/App.Preference</item>
        <item name="preferenceCategoryStyle">@style/App.Preference.Category</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Custom Preference Style - No parent, define everything explicitly -->
    <style name="App.Preference">
        <item name="android:layout">@layout/preference_material</item>
        <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
        <item name="summaryTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceSummary</item>
        <item name="android:selectable">true</item>
    </style>

    <!-- Custom Preference Category Style -->
    <style name="App.Preference.Category">
        <item name="android:layout">@layout/preference_category_material</item>
        <item name="titleTextAppearance">@style/AppTextAppearance.PreferenceTitle</item>
        <item name="android:selectable">false</item>
    </style>

<resources xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools">

    <style name="Theme.OSRSWiki" parent="Theme.Material3.DayNight.NoActionBar">

        <item name="colorOnPrimary">@color/osrs_text_light</item>

        <item name="colorOnSecondaryContainer">@color/osrs_gold_muted</item>
        <item name="colorError">@color/color_error</item>
        <item name="colorOnError">@color/white</item>
        <item name="android:colorBackground">@color/osrs_parchment_dark</item>
        <item name="colorOnBackground">@color/osrs_text_light_alt</item>

        <item name="textAppearanceLabelMedium">@style/AppTextAppearance.Label</item>
        <item name="textAppearanceLabelSmall">@style/AppTextAppearance.Caption</item>
    </style>



    <style name="Widget.App.ActionMode" parent="Widget.Material3.ActionMode">
        <item name="background">?attr/colorSurface</item>
        <item name="backgroundSplit">@drawable/action_mode_border</item>
        <item name="elevation">0dp</item>
